TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GridViewRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> class supports several ways to access the items in the collection:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and display the values of a column on the page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollection/CS/gridviewrowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollection/VB/gridviewrowcollectionvb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ArrayList rows) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains the objects with which to initialize the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object. The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object should contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based object that receives the copied items from the object.
The first index in the specified object to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this to the specified object, starting at the specified index in the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index. The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object for the `array` parameter.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items of collection into an array. The array is iterated through and the values of the first cell are displayed on the page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo/CS/gridviewrowcollectioncopytocs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo/VB/gridviewrowcollectioncopytovb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the object.
Docs.value: The number of items in the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of items in the collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control contains any records. A value greater than zero indicates that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control contains at least one record.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollection/CS/gridviewrowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollection/VB/gridviewrowcollectionvb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that contains all objects in the .
Docs.returns: An implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection>. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. Otherwise, the item that is represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that contains the values from the collection. The enumerator is iterated through and the values of the first cell are displayed on the page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator/CS/gridviewrowcollectiongetenumeratorcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator/VB/gridviewrowcollectiongetenumeratorvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the object can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is thread-safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is not thread-safe.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.param: The index of the object to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object from the collection. The values of the cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object are displayed on the page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[GridViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionIndexer/CS/gridviewrowcollectionindexercs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowCollectionIndexer/VB/gridviewrowcollectionindexervb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection. The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object itself.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional object that is the destination of the elements copied from the interface. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in a object at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
